summary: More hotkeys and quick access to essential functions = more enjoyable gaming experience with Xbox 360 pad. Two versions: Vanilla+ and MyConfig.
descriptionHtml:
Contains two different versions. See the images above for a better explanation. Only changes and additions are marked in the images, otherwise the buttons are in default settings. LB is short for left shoulder button, HK for hotkey.

[b]Vanilla+:[/b]
-Everything is like in vanilla configuration. (Except one thing. See known problems below.)
-Added 4 hotkeys for a total of 6.
-Added quicksave, quickload, fast access to skills, map, items, magic.
-Additions:[list]
 [*]D-Pad down = Hotkey 2
 [*]D-Pad right, down or left + LB = Hotkeys 4-6
 [*]Y,B,A or X + LB = Skills, Items, Map or Magic
 [*]Start + LB = Quickload
 [*]RB + LB = Quicksave
 [/list]


[b]MyConfig:[/b]
-Two buttons changed from vanilla.
-Added 6 hotkeys for a total of 8.
-Added quicksave, quickload, fast access to skills, map, items, magic.
-Changes:[list]
 [*]Back = Favorites
 [*]Back + LB = Wait
 [*]See known problems below.
[/list]
-Additions:[list]
 [*]D-Pad up or down = Hotkey 1 or 3
 [*]D-Pad up, right, down or left + LB = Hotkeys 5-8
 [*]Y,B,A or X + LB = Skills, Items, Map or Magic
 [*]Start + LB = Quickload
 [*]RB + LB = Quicksave
[/list]


I took the best parts from existing mods and made my own. These have only everything I need and nothing more. Keeping it simple but improving usability quite a lot. I just wanted to try a little modding (if you even can call this simple thing modding) and share this with people.

If you find any bugs, you can report them in the comments section.

[b]Known problems:[/b]
You can\'t use the D-Pad in the favorites menu. This is not a problem if you use the analog stick.

[b]Installation:[/b]
Just put the version you want in your Skyrim/Data/Interface/controls/pc folder. It must be named controlmap.txt. Or just use NMM. [color=orange]If you have the file Controlmap_Custom.txt in your Skyrim main folder, delete it. It stores your previous key settings so you might want to make a backup of it.[/color]

[b]Uninstallation:[/b]
Remove the controlmap.txt from your Skyrim/Data/Interface/controls/pc folder. Or use NMM.

[b]Recommendations:[/b]
I\'m using [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5229]Natural Favorites Expanded Menu System by dragonalumni[/url]. This makes controlling favorites and hotkeys easier.

[b]Updates:[/b]
1.1. Added NMM compatibility.
